title: August safari, Palm Springs architecture
text:
Right of way: nothing stops a giraffe crossing a river in the Masai Mara (Alamy) I’m looking to book a family holiday in Africa in August. Which countries are safe, and can we combine a safari with five to seven days on a beach without it being too expensive?
Mrs Kelly J Lindsay, Aberdeen
Adam Edwards replies
South Africa, Tanzania and Kenya (as long as you steer clear of Nairobi’s slums and the border with Somalia) best tick the boxes, although you’ll need to take antimalarials for the last two. August is the dry season: there are lots of animals to see, but prices tend to be higher.
If you can’t hold off, Tanzania is gorgeous in August, with little rainfall or humidity on the coast. Imagine Africa has three nights in Selous — a wilderness that’s home to some of the largest elephant and lion populations on the planet — followed by five nights on Lazy Lagoon, a private island.
